name: Browned Butter Apple Pie Dip
author: Anonymous
summary: This recipes blends the richness of browned butter and fried apples in a rich, dessert dip that captures the tastes of an American favorite. An easy-to-eat finger food that will have your guests coming back for more.
ingredients: ½ cup LAND O LAKES® Butter
1 (15 ounce) package pie dough for a double-crust pie
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in skillet over medium heat
Saute apples until medium-firm, 2 to 3 minutes
Add 1/4 cup white sugar and pinch of salt
Cook until apples begin to brown, 3 to 5 minutes longer
Remove apples from the skillet and allow to cool
Wipe out skillet with a paper towel
Place 1/2 cup of butter in skillet over medium heat
Constantly swirl the butter in the pan, watching carefully so butter does not burn
The butter is "browned" when it is a tan color and smells nutty
This can take 3 to 10 minutes
When butter is ready, promptly pour it into a bowl to prevent it from burning
Add 1/2 cup white sugar to the apples and stir until sugar is well incorporated
In a mixing bowl, combine browned butter, powdered sugar, cream cheese, vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon until well combined
Add apple mixture and stir until well-blended
Unroll the pie crust on a silicone mat
Using a small cookie cutter, press out the pie crust "chips
" Lift the pie crust up, leaving the "chips" on the mat
Place the mat on a baking sheet
The remaining dough may be rolled out to 1/4" thick and the process repeated to use up all the dough and make more "chips" using separate silicone mats (or parchment)
Bake in preheated oven, bake 6-7 minutes, watching carefully to ensure the chips to not burn
Allow the chips to cool
Place on serving plate
Spoon the dip into a serving bowl; serve with chips for dipping
